intro: Aconitum degenii var. turrachense, commonly known as the Turrachense monkshood, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple spurred flowers. The plant features palmately lobed leaves and produces showy, helmet-shaped blooms that attract pollinators. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
